verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they turn and encamp before Pihahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, over against Baalzephon: before it shall ye encamp by the sea.
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, that they turn back and encamp before Pihahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal Zephon. You shall encamp opposite it by the sea.
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites to turn back and set up camp near Pihahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, facing Baalzephon. Camp there right by the sea.

verses.kjv: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are entangled in the land, the wilderness hath shut them in.
verses.web: Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, ‘They are entangled in the land. The wilderness has shut them in.’
verses.ct: Pharaoh will look at the Israelites and think, 'They're lost and wandering. The wilderness has trapped them.'

verses.kjv: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, that he shall follow after them; and I will be honoured upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host; that the Egyptians may know that I am the LORD. And they did so.
verses.web: I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and he will follow after them; and I will get honor over Pharaoh, and over all his armies; and the Egyptians shall know that I am LORD.” They did so.
verses.ct: I will harden Pharaoh's heart so he chases after them, and I will gain glory through Pharaoh and his entire army. Then the Egyptians will know that I am the LORD." So the Israelites did exactly that.

verses.kjv: And it was told the king of Egypt that the people fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people, and they said, Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
verses.web: The king of Egypt was told that the people had fled; and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was changed toward the people, and they said, “What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go from serving us?”
verses.ct: When the king of Egypt received word that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his officials had a change of heart. "What have we done?" they said. "We let Israel go — we've lost our entire workforce!"

verses.kjv: And he made ready his chariot, and took his people with him:
verses.web: He prepared his chariot, and took his army with him;
verses.ct: So Pharaoh prepared his chariot and assembled his army.

verses.kjv: And he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over every one of them.
verses.web: and he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, with captains over all of them.
verses.ct: He took 600 of his best chariots along with every other chariot in Egypt, each one commanded by an officer.

verses.kjv: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued after the children of Israel: and the children of Israel went out with an high hand.
verses.web: LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued the children of Israel; for the children of Israel went out with a high hand.
verses.ct: The LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued the Israelites, who had marched out boldly and defiantly.

verses.kjv: But the Egyptians pursued after them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army, and overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pihahiroth, before Baalzephon.
verses.web: The Egyptians pursued them. All the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, his horsemen, and his army overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pihahiroth, before Baal Zephon.
verses.ct: The Egyptians gave chase — all of Pharaoh's horses, chariots, horsemen, and soldiers — and caught up with the Israelites as they were camped by the sea near Pihahiroth, across from Baalzephon.

verses.kjv: And when Pharaoh drew nigh, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and, behold, the Egyptians marched after them; and they were sore afraid: and the children of Israel cried out unto the LORD.
verses.web: When Pharaoh came near, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians were marching after them; and they were very afraid. The children of Israel cried out to LORD.
verses.ct: As Pharaoh's army drew close, the Israelites looked up and saw the Egyptians bearing down on them. Terror gripped them, and they cried out to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? wherefore hast thou dealt thus with us, to carry us forth out of Egypt?
verses.web: They said to Moses, “Because there were no graves in Egypt, have you taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why have you treated us this way, to bring us out of Egypt?
verses.ct: They turned on Moses: "Were there not enough graves in Egypt? Is that why you brought us out here to die in the wilderness? What have you done to us by dragging us out of Egypt?"

verses.kjv: Is not this the word that we did tell thee in Egypt, saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it had been better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.
verses.web: Isn’t this the word that we spoke to you in Egypt, saying, ‘Leave us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians?’ For it would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness.”
verses.ct: "Didn't we tell you back in Egypt, 'Leave us alone — let us serve the Egyptians'? It would have been better to live as slaves than to die out here in the wilderness!"

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of the LORD, which he will shew to you to day: for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to day, ye shall see them again no more for ever.
verses.web: Moses said to the people, “Don’t be afraid. Stand still, and see the salvation of LORD, which he will work for you today; for you will never again see the Egyptians whom you have seen today.
verses.ct: Moses answered the people, "Don't be afraid! Stand your ground and watch — today the LORD will rescue you. The Egyptians you see right now? You will never see them again.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
verses.web: LORD will fight for you, and you shall be still.”
verses.ct: The LORD will fight for you. All you have to do is be still."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Wherefore criest thou unto me? speak unto the children of Israel, that they go forward:
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Why do you cry to me? Speak to the children of Israel, that they go forward.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Moses, "Why are you crying out to me? Tell the Israelites to move forward.

verses.kjv: But lift thou up thy rod, and stretch out thine hand over the sea, and divide it: and the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
verses.web: Lift up your rod, and stretch out your hand over the sea and divide it. Then the children of Israel shall go into the middle of the sea on dry ground.
verses.ct: Raise your staff and stretch your hand out over the sea to divide it. The Israelites will walk through the middle of the sea on dry ground.

verses.kjv: And I, behold, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall follow them: and I will get me honour upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
verses.web: Behold, I myself will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they will go in after them. I will get myself honor over Pharaoh, and over all his armies, over his chariots, and over his horsemen.
verses.ct: I myself will harden the Egyptians' hearts so they follow right in after them. Then I will gain glory through Pharaoh and his entire army — his chariots and his horsemen.

verses.kjv: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I have gotten me honour upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
verses.web: The Egyptians shall know that I am LORD when I have gotten myself honor over Pharaoh, over his chariots, and over his horsemen.”
verses.ct: The Egyptians will know that I am the LORD when I have gained glory through Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen."

verses.kjv: And the angel of God, which went before the camp of Israel, removed and went behind them; and the pillar of the cloud went from before their face, and stood behind them:
verses.web: The angel of God, who went before the camp of Israel, moved and went behind them; and the pillar of cloud moved from before them, and stood behind them.
verses.ct: Then the angel of God, who had been leading the Israelite camp from the front, moved to the rear. The pillar of cloud also shifted from in front of them and took its place behind them.

verses.kjv: And it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel; and it was a cloud and darkness to them, but it gave light by night to these: so that the one came not near the other all the night.
verses.web: It came between the camp of Egypt and the camp of Israel. There was the cloud and the darkness, yet gave it light by night. One didn’t come near the other all night.
verses.ct: It stood between the Egyptian camp and the Israelite camp. On the Egyptian side, the cloud brought darkness, but on the Israelite side, it gave light through the night. So neither army came near the other all night long.

verses.kjv: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
verses.web: Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
verses.ct: Moses stretched his hand out over the sea, and the LORD drove the sea back with a powerful east wind that blew all night. The seabed became dry land, and the waters split apart.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
verses.web: The children of Israel went into the middle of the sea on the dry ground, and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand, and on their left.
verses.ct: The Israelites walked into the middle of the sea on dry ground, with walls of water standing on their right and on their left.

verses.kjv: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.web: The Egyptians pursued, and went in after them into the middle of the sea: all of Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.ct: The Egyptians charged in after them — all of Pharaoh's horses, chariots, and horsemen — right into the middle of the sea.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that in the morning watch the LORD looked unto the host of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of the cloud, and troubled the host of the Egyptians,
verses.web: In the morning watch, LORD looked out on the Egyptian army through the pillar of fire and of cloud, and confused the Egyptian army.
verses.ct: In the early hours of the morning, the LORD looked down on the Egyptian army through the pillar of fire and cloud and threw them into confusion.

verses.kjv: And took off their chariot wheels, that they drave them heavily: so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for the LORD fighteth for them against the Egyptians.
verses.web: He took off their chariot wheels, and they drove them heavily; so that the Egyptians said, “Let’s flee from the face of Israel, for LORD fights for them against the Egyptians!”
verses.ct: He jammed their chariot wheels so they could barely move. The Egyptians cried out, "Let's get away from Israel! The LORD is fighting for them against us!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the sea, that the waters may come again on the Egyptians, on their chariots, and on their horsemen.”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Stretch your hand out over the sea so the waters crash back over the Egyptians, their chariots, and their horsemen."

verses.kjv: And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to his strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and the LORD overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
verses.web: Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to its strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it. LORD overthrew the Egyptians in the middle of the sea.
verses.ct: Moses stretched his hand out over the sea, and at dawn the water rushed back to its full force. The Egyptians tried to flee, but the LORD swept them into the sea.

verses.kjv: And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.
verses.web: The waters returned, and covered the chariots and the horsemen, even all Pharaoh’s army that went in after them into the sea. There remained not so much as one of them.
verses.ct: The waters surged back and swallowed the chariots, the horsemen, and every last soldier of Pharaoh's army that had followed the Israelites into the sea. Not a single one survived.

verses.kjv: But the children of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
verses.web: But the children of Israel walked on dry land in the middle of the sea, and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand, and on their left.
verses.ct: But the Israelites had walked through the middle of the sea on dry ground, with walls of water on their right and on their left.

verses.kjv: Thus the LORD saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea shore.
verses.web: Thus LORD saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore.
verses.ct: That day the LORD rescued Israel from the power of Egypt. The Israelites saw the bodies of the Egyptians washed up on the shore.

verses.kjv: And Israel saw that great work which the LORD did upon the Egyptians: and the people feared the LORD, and believed the LORD, and his servant Moses.
verses.web: Israel saw the great work which LORD did to the Egyptians, and the people feared LORD; and they believed in LORD and in his servant Moses.
verses.ct: When Israel witnessed the incredible display of power the LORD unleashed against the Egyptians, the people feared the LORD. They put their faith in the LORD and in his servant Moses.
